lines.gurmukhi: Pl PUl mUl Pl mUl Pl Pl mUl Awid prmwid Aru AMq kY AnMq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhal Dhool Mool Dhal Mool Dhal Dhal Moola , Aadi Paramaadi Aru Ant Kai Anant Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: From fruit one begets a seed and seed develops into a tree to give fruit, and this process continues. This system of growth has been in vogue before the beginning. Its end is beyond the end.

lines.gurmukhi: ipq suq suq ipq suq ipq ipq suq auqpiq giq Aiq gUV mUl mMq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Pit Sout Sout Pit Sout Pit Pit Souta , Outapati Gati Ati Goorh Mool Mant Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Father begets a son and the son then becomes a father and begets son. Thus continues the system of father-son-father. This convention of creation has very deep quintessence.

lines.gurmukhi: piQk bsyrw ko inbyrw ijau inkis bYT ieq auq vwr pwr sirqw isDq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Padik Basayraa Ko Nibayraa Jiu Nikasi Baittha , It Out Vaar Paar Saritaa Sidhat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As the end of journey of a traveller depends upon his embarking a boat and then de-embarking from it, crossing the river defines its near and far ends, and these ends keep changing depending upon which direction a traveller is crossing the river from.

lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm gur goibMd goibMd gur Aibgq giq ismrq isK sMq hY ]56]
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Gur Gobind Gobind Gur , Abigat Gati Simarat Sikh Sant Hai ?56?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly all powerful, all knowing Guru is God Himself. He is both Guru and God. This incomprehensible state can best be understood by a Guru-conscious person. (56)
